pyLib.io.codeio module¶

codeio.py

I/O in terms of code such as load a module from another directory

pyLib.io.codeio.load_source(module_name, file_path)¶

Load a module from a source file with selected name.

Parameters:
  • module_name – str, the name of the module
  • file_path – str, the path to the source file

pyLib.io.fileio module¶

fileio.py

Useful functions for file io, especially dict of dict type. This type is heavily used for clustered training.

pyLib.io.fileio.assignModule(module, dct)¶

Assign values in dict to the module

pyLib.io.fileio.assignModuleByJson(module, fnm)¶

Change contents of a module by json file

pyLib.io.fileio.ddctParse(fnm, thekey=None)¶

Parse a file that is dict of dict. I wish this is faster than pickle

pyLib.io.fileio.ddctSave(fnm, arr, pklmode=False)¶

pyLib.io.sharedmemory module¶

sharedmemory.py

A module that supports shared memory.

class pyLib.io.sharedmemory.SharedMemory¶

Bases: object

A class for managing shared memory.

We use a folder style format for managing files, folder names means a dict. The user is able to add ndarray and dict as file, folder The user is able to read any file, folder, too. It returns ndarray and dict

addObject(obj, name=None, noalter=False, replace=False)¶

Add an object this obj can be either ndarray or dict of ndarray.

clean()¶

Clean those attributes with (x)

clear(name=None)¶
getObject(name)¶

Retrieve an object by name.

We first check if it is a name to the file, by checking if it is in self.keys Then we check if we refer to a folder by checking all names begins with name/ After getting a list of keys, we construct arrays / dicts

loadMemory()¶

Call the sa api to get all names.

reportKeys()¶
pyLib.io.sharedmemory.add(obj, name=None, noalter=False, replace=True)¶

Add an object to the environment. If name is None, it is directly added to root.

obj : ndarray / dict / dict of dict, the data waiting to be added name : str, name assigned to the object, if it is None and obj is dict, its keys are added to root noalter : bool, if set to True, existing keys will not be modified replace : bool, only when noalter is False, if set to True, it replace a data instead of creating a one with non-conflict name

pyLib.io.sharedmemory.clean()¶

Clean redundant entries

pyLib.io.sharedmemory.clear()¶

This clear current environment.

pyLib.io.sharedmemory.clearSA()¶
pyLib.io.sharedmemory.get(name)¶

Get an object from the environment

pyLib.io.sharedmemory.has(name)¶

Check if a name is in keys

pyLib.io.sharedmemory.list()¶

Show all keys.
